channel.title: Algorithms on NOWHERESVILLE
channel.description: Recent content in Algorithms on NOWHERESVILLE

item.title: Algorithms-Design and Analysis(Stanford) Notes
item.description: Divide and Conquer 分而治之 Master Method a “black-box” method for solving recurrences determine the running time for most of the D&C algos 3 cases Proof Interpretations Counting Inversions problem: counting # of inversions in an array measuring similarity between 2 ranked lists => making good recommendations => collaborative filtering Karatsuba Multiplication Problem: multiplication of two $n$-digit numbers $x, y$ (base 10) Simple method: $O(n^2)$ bit operations Recursive method: $$ x = 10^{n/2}a+b, y = 10^{n/2}c+d, \text{ where }a,b,c,d\text{ are }\frac{n}{2}-\text{digit numbers} $$

item.title: TwoSum in Python
item.description: 方式一：Brute Force class Solution: def twoSum(self, nums, target): for idx1, element in enumerate(nums): try: idx2 = nums[idx1 + 1:].index(target - element) + idx1 + 1 except ValueError: continue return [idx1, idx2] return None Time complexity: $O(n^2)$ Space complexity: $O(1)$ Leetcode Submission Detail: Runtime: 1629 ms Beats 17.69% of python3 submissions 方式二：One-pass Hash Table class Solution: def twoSum(self, nums, target): numDict = {} for idx1, element in enumerate(nums): try: idx2 = numDict[target - element] except KeyError: numDict[element] = idx1 continue return [idx1, idx2] return None Time complexity: $O(n)$ Space complexity: $O(n)$ Leetcode Submission Detail: Runtime: 61 ms Beats 73.
